Message: Some initial stuff, some of it works
Some more working stuff & repl love

Check in latest stuff

Good enough to have lots of fun with the repl!
New png video streaming and other things

Implement client.sequence() feature

Makes it easy to script hardcoded flight sequences.

Add PngSplitter#end

Just needs to be there so Stream#pipe() does not freak out when the
source is done and it is trying to close the destination.

This allows extracting h264 frames from the video feed. The next
challenge is to embedd them into a browser streamable format (like mp4)

Instructions to install from Github

Makes a lot of sense for this lib which is changing fast

Use npm test as primary test runner.

Makefiles are not cross-platform, but if you want one, it can delegate to npm (which *is* cross-platform).

See https://gist.github.com/2790533 for more tips on writing portable Node.js code.

Unsure `ARDrone_SDK_2_0/ARDroneLib/Soft/Common/navdata_common.h:753` has `uint32_t link_quality` but using that:

 * Breaks a test
 * Produces a value from 0 - 500
 * Causes strange behavior[^1]

[^1]: (Values were observed to start at 500 and gradually decline to 0 in about 10 seconds. Sometime later the value would incrementally increase back to 500 and, again, slide back down to 0.)

Maintain a single png and tcp stream in client

Introducing two new API calls: getPngStream() and getVideoStream().
Multiple calls to these methods return the same objects. The underlying
TcpVideoStream is the same and its lifecylce (connect/reconnect) is
managed by the client.

Preliminary GPS support

Fixed errors in GPS data definitions.

* Fixed incorrect order of unk0 & data_available fields.
* Fixed misspellings.
* Many fields are actually arrays (this was causing a lot of fields to
have nonsense values).

Based on https://github.com/paparazzi/paparazzi/blob/55e3d9d79119f81ed0b11a59487280becf13cf40/sw/airborne/boards/ardrone/at_com.h

* Removed the failing zimmu3000 option test--I think it's been obsoleted
by GPS.

* Fixed up test/fixtures/navdata.bin by replacing what looked like a bogus GPS
option with a real one, recorded from firmware 2.4.7 (and updated the checksum
of the entire data packet).

Not all values look legit to me--longitude, hdop and vdop look suspicious.

I changed droneTimeToMilliseconds so it won't return negative times and
fixed gps.last_frame_timestamp to be in milliseconds.

Merge pull request #73 from wiseman/fix_tests

Fixed parse-Navdata tests and added tests for gps.

Added handling of ACK for config commands.

We now have two classes of commands: blocking and non-blocking.
`CONFIG` is blocking, all others are non-blocking.  When a blocking
command is sent, no other blocking commands will be sent until an ACK
is received (and cleared) from the AR.Drone.
Added unit tests for CONFIG ACKs.

config can now be called as config(key, value, callback) or config(options).

Fixed config signature to bring callback out of options.

Increased default timeout to 500 ms.

Also removed vestigal retries references.
Increased delay in test to trigger timeout.

Changed NavdataReader.char to call buffy Reader.char.

This fixes the bug where char wasn't advancing the buffer pointer,
causing bad parses of the magneto and kalmanPressure navdata options
(issue #90).

Updated GPS navdata definition for firmware version 2.4.8.

I also took this opportunity to rename GPS data fields to be
consistent with existing nomenclature (that is, degreeMag instead of
degree_mag).

The new data definitions come from
https://github.com/AutonomyLab/ardrone_autonomy/pull/95 which
supposedly came via backchannels from Parrot.

I spliced a GPS navdata option collected from a drone running 2.4.8
into test/fixtures/navdata.bin and updated the unit tests.

Fixes client up/down, left/right, front/back, clockwise/counterclockwise functions to accept 0 speed. Adds test. Resolves #106

Previous implementation would not allow one to supply 0 for speed to stop moving along that axis. The only way to stop would be to issue a client.stop(). But that would also cancel any other movement going on at the time.
For example, centering a joystick should stop pitch, but should not stop yaw being controlled by a dpad on the same controller.
